thread.title: OK, 100 more reruns of the fourth quarter should do it
thread.title_full: OK, 100 more reruns of the fourth quarter should do it

author: Dwight Perry / Sideline Chatter
title: OK, 100 more reruns of the fourth quarter should do it
text:
OK, 100 more reruns of the fourth quarter should do it Originally published October 20, 2015 at 4:58 pm Updated October 20, 2015 at 4:59 pm Is there some cosmic connection between ‘Groundhog Day’ and the Seattle Seahawks? 
Hear about plans for a “Groundhog Day” sequel? 
In this one, Bill Murray portrays Phil, a Seahawks DB, in the fourth quarter. NFL headlines 
• At TheOnion.com: “Ed Hochuli horrified after dozens of biceps begin growing all over body.” 
• At SportsPickle.com: “Slideshow: 28 mallards that look like Peyton passes.” Hurts So Good Dept. 
Jalen Watts-Jackson — the Michigan State player who picked up the fumbled punt snap and returned it 38 yards to stun Michigan as time expired — broke his hip when his over-exuberant teammates pig-piled on top of him. 
So what if he never had a Heisman shot? His Kendrys Morales Trophy is in the bag. Stat of the Week 
The Indianapolis Colts are 25-13 the past two-plus NFL regular seasons — 15-0 against their AFC South rivals and 10-13 against the rest of the league. Sports quiz 
From Steve Schrader of the Detroit Free Press: “How did the NFL punish the official who blew the end-zone call in the Lions-Seahawks game? 
a) “He was removed from (the Oct. 18) prime-time game. 
b) “He has to do a book report on ‘NFL Rules for Dummies.’ 
c) “He has to run laps. 
d) “The loss still stands. Oh, wait, that’s how the Lions got punished.” Fool me once … 
Retired catcher Jason Varitek interviewed for the Mariners’ vacant managerial job, CBSsports.com reported. 
But only after the team promised not to trade him for Heathcliff Slocumb again. Death and Texas 
Bevo XIV, the University of Texas’ longhorn mascot, has passed away from bovine leukemia. 
Funeral services, we assume, will pre-empt regular programming on the Longhorn Network. Talking the talk 
• CSN Bay Area’s Ray Ratto, via Twitter, on baseball’s so-called unwritten rules: “There is only one, and I’m writing it now. If what you did pisses me off, you broke the rule. You’re welcome.” 
• Times reader Bill Littlejohn, on Michigan’s final-play blunder against Michigan State: “Maybe Michigan should have tried Chuck Pagano’s fake punt.” 
• Reader Chas K, to the Cleveland Plain Dealer: “Interesting weekend: I saw the tooth fairy, the Easter Bunny and the Browns’ pass rush.” 
• Paul Klee of the Colorado Springs Gazette, after the Broncos went 27 straight drives without an offensive touchdown: “What once was a Ferrari is now a Zamboni on grass.” Buckle up 
The world’s tallest roller coaster — going 223 feet high and reaching speeds of 75 mph — is under construction in Sandusky, Ohio. 
The ride’s ups and downs come so fast, insiders say, that they nearly named it the Magnum Manziel. Dwight Perry: 206-464-8250 or dperry@seattletimes.com
